abstract.text: An object that describes a sent or received message.

inlineContent.text: When your app responds to an

, you create instances of this class to provide Siri with information about the messages in your app. Each message contains a unique identifier, the participantsâ€™ details, and the content. You can group messages into larger discussions and, if you app supports multiple services, identify the service that delivers each message.

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
An object that describes a sent or received message.
An audio recording that Siri plays to the message recipient.
The text that Siri recites to the message recipient.
The identifier of the conversation that contains this message.
The date and time the app sent the message to each recipient.
The name of the grouped conversation.
The messageâ€™s unique identifier.
Creates a message with the specified content.
Creates a message with the specified content and an optional group name.
Creates a message with the specified content and an optional service name.
Creates a message with the specified content and an optional audio message file.
Creates a message of a distinct type with the specified content.
The type of content the message contains.
The people who received the message.
The person who sent the message.
The name of the service that delivers the message.
Constants that indicate an attribute of a message.
Constants that indicate a message search filter.
Constants that describe the kinds of content a message can contain.
Information about a person participating in a SiriKit interaction.
A request to list the messages that match the specified criteria.
Donate app-specific content, use Siriâ€™s contact suggestions, and adopt the latest platform features to create a more consistent messaging experience.

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
